thread.title: Madison man accused of strangling person at UW Arboretum
thread.title_full: Madison man accused of strangling person at UW Arboretum

author: @nbc15_madison
title: Madison man accused of strangling person at UW Arboretum
text:
Madison man accused of strangling person at UW Arboretum
MADISON, Wis. (WMTV) - UW-Madison Police Department arrested a man after a person reported being strangled last week in the UW Arboretum.
An aggravated assault was reported to UWPD the morning of Monday, March 31, explained UWPD. The victim reported being strangled and forced to wait in a vehicle during the attack.
UWPD indicated the victim was taken to a Madison-area hospital to be evaluated and treated.
UWPD detectives and officers arrested Nahum Herrera Varela on Friday, April 4, during a traffic stop as he left work. Police stated the 37-year-old Madison man faces charges of false imprisonment and strangulation/suffocation.
Herrera Varela, who is not affiliated with UW-Madison, is being held in the Dane County Jail.
His bond was set at $10,000 in Dane County Court on Tuesday, court records show.
